summary: The Military Chaplains Act of 2025 aims to define and codify the roles, duties, qualifications, and protections for military chaplains across the Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, Air Force, and Space Force.  It establishes the roles of the Chief of Chaplains within each branch, outlining responsibilities related to religious accommodation, spiritual readiness, and chaplain conduct. The bill explicitly protects chaplains' rights regarding religious expression, counseling, and refusal to perform actions conflicting with their beliefs. Enforcement mechanisms and definitions are provided, as well as conforming amendments to existing law.
